option.value: I want to setup a github action workflow using a yml file that will automatically setup a test environment and run the necessary tests. Please create the necessary folders and yml file.

Why did this not run any tests?
Install the latest PowerShell for new features and improvements! https://aka.ms/PSWindows
(mercbot-py3.11) PS C:\Users\garre\PycharmProjects\mercbot> poetry run python -m unittest discover tests
---------------------------------------------------------------------- Ran 0 tests in 0.000s
OK (mercbot-py3.11) PS C:\Users\garre\PycharmProjects\mercbot>

Enhance the production.py module to automatically identify and update the database with the production chains based on the player's current buildings, available recipes, and existing resources. It should handle multiple buildings that produce the same item being parrallel in the production chain.

Enhance the production.py module to automatically identify and update the database with production chains based on the player's current buildings, available recipes, and existing resources. It should handle multiple buildings that produce the same item being parrallel in the production chain. Production chains also need to take into account that multiple buildings may use a produced ingredient, such as multiple carpentry shops each producing a different end product, all use timber produced by the sawmill, which uses lumber from 2 distinct lumber yards. Production chains also need to take into account buldings that produce multiple things, such as a pasture producing both milk for a dairy building to use and meat for a butcher building to use and manure for a grain farm to use.

for building in player.buildings: if building.production: recipe = str(building.production.recipe) # Convert recipe to string if recipe not in production_chains: production_chains[recipe] = [] production_chains[recipe].append({ "building_id": building.id, > "size": building.size, "target": building.production.target }) E AttributeError: 'MockBuilding' object has no attribute 'size'

eventually I want this to have a web front end. setup a super basic web front end for this that simply has a page that displays the detected production chains for the users in the database.
Feel free to create folders and files as necessary and use whatever python modules make the most sense
please add unit tests as needed
I'm using poetry for this project. Shouldn't we use poetry for the webapp too, instead of pip and requirements.txt?

Add in flags to enable or disable the functionality we currently have setup in main on a per player basis. Additionally we should have one overarching flag for whether any "writes" are allowed using the API, that overrules other flags that may cover a small subsection of features about write functionality. Store these in the database per player and have default values for the flags in the setup_database.py

Our database contains json strings. that's like extrmely terrible database design. please look at the database and reestructure it to follow best practices. we'll have users each of which could have one or more player accounts. users should be able to authenticate into our webapp and entere in their api usernames and api tokens and character nicknames (optional -- filled in with the Head of Household's name from the game if left blank). we should have a settings table that stores a single setting for a single user in each row, unless there's a better best practice way to handle it.

I feel like we should be using django or something for for the webapp. Something with plugins to handle authentication and other stuff as we go forward. What would be the best framework / python module to use for that? Only the web frontend will need to use it.
Please restructure our web frontend to use django.

I'm using poetry for this project. Please get rid of any requirements.txt and use poetry for it instead. Please give me poetry style instructions for running manage.py migrate and manage.py createsuperuser and manage.py runserver
